page.pg_title: Conduct an Xrefs Contracts Search Using Lease Numbers

text_content.paragraph: Sometimes you may want to see the relationships between a contract and other company assets. You can do so by conducting an Xrefs search.
The demonstration below describes the steps for finding contracts using the Xrefs search type. Select Play to view the demonstration.

cc_text.paragraph: It may be necessary for you to see the relationships between a contract and other company assets. You can do so by conducting an Xrefs search.
The demonstration below describes the steps for finding contracts using the Xrefs search type. Select Play to view the demonstration.
Verify that you are in the Contracts tab.
Begin your search at the Search Sidebar.
Click the small arrow to the right on the Xrefs search type title bar. The Xrefs search type expands.
Type a few lease numbers in the Lease Number(s) field. Use commas to separate each lease number.
Once the search criteria have been filled in click the Search button. The data grid expands with the results. You can also hit the Enter key on your keyboard, instead of the Search button.
